abstract: New York City's Environmental Protection Dept is selling Newtown Creek, 300-foot-long tanker that has been tasked with disposing of city's sewage sludge since 1967; tanker's online auction, with opening bid of $235,000, drew no formal votes, but buyers have expressed interest.
lead_paragraph: The bidding window for the Newtown Creek, put out to pasture last summer after nearly half a century of hauling New Yorkers’ sewage, ended without a formal offer.

headline.main: For Sale: Aging Boat That Had an Unenviable Job
headline.print_headline: For Sale: Aging Boat That Had Unenviable Job

snippet: The bidding window for the Newtown Creek, put out to pasture last summer after nearly half a century of hauling New Yorkers’ sewage, ended without a formal offer.
